moves.1. d4 d6 2. e4 e5 3. dxe5 dxe5 4. Qxd8+:
This is still a puzzle to me, as the better sacrifice in my opinion would've been 18 .. Nxg4 19 hxg4 Bxg4 and the pawn on f5 follows soon with pressure the f2/f3 pawn.
Another option could've been 18.. Bxg4 19 hxg4 Nxg4 20 f3 Nh6 and the f5 pawn following soon again still with pressure on f3 pawn.
moves.19. gxh5 Ng3 20. Ne4 Nxh5 21. Bg5+ Nf6 2: Not that you had any choices, but that was on que for me to  play the next move.
moves.28. Rd7 h5 29. Nd5 Rac8 30. f4: I don't want the e5 pawn out of the way, it's in my path to line up the rooks on the 7th file.
moves.30... exf4 31. Ree7: That sacrifice is helping me to put pressure on that c7 pawn.
moves.31... f3 32. Nxc7: ignore the advance, I'm more interested in pressure on the king!
moves.32... Rfg8+: It's still just postponing the inevitable.
moves.33. Kf2 Rxc7:
The knight is in a good spot, so the king can't move, so this is the only way 
to prevent a quick checkmate.
moves.34. Rdxc7+ Kb8 35. Rcb7+ Kc8 36. Rxb6 Rg: It was more a delaying tactic and a lure.
moves.38... Rxa4: Fell in "trap" to delay the rook to hep prepare my rooks for checkmate of the isolated king.
moves.41. Rh6: and black can't prevent Rh8#, only delay it with 41... Ra3 , 42 Kf4 Rf3 /Rg3 43 KxR .. 44 RH8# or 42... R
